item.title: Upload via link
item.description: Upload via linkIf you have videos stored in a cloud storage bucket, you can simply pass a HTTP link for the file. Stream will fetch the file and make it available for streaming. By using webhooks you can receive a notification when the video is ready to be played or if it errors. ​​ Step 1: Make an API call with the link Make a HTTP request to the Stream API with the URL of the video.

item.title: Upload a video file
item.description: Upload a video file ​​ Basic Uploads (for small videos) For files smaller than 200MB you can use simple form based uploads. This is an easy way to upload but does not support resumable uploading. Make an HTTP request with content-type header set to multipart/form-data and include the media as an input with the name set to file. ​​ cURL example curl -X POST \ -H "Authorization: Bearer <API_TOKEN>" \ -F file=@/Users/kyle/Desktop/video.

item.title: Direct creator uploads
item.description: Direct creator uploadsDirect creator uploads let your end users to upload videos directly to Cloudflare Stream, without exposing your API token to clients. Two options: For videos under 200MB, generate URLs that accept an HTTP POST request. For videos over 200MB, or if you need to allow users to resume uploads that may be interrupted by poor network connections or users closing your app while videos are still uploading, generate URLs that use the tus protocol.

item.title: Player API
item.description: Player APIAttributes are added in the <stream> tag without quotes, as you can see below: <stream attribute-added-here src="5d5bc37ffcf54c9b82e996823bffbb81"></stream> Multiple attributes can be used together, added one after each other like this: <stream attribute-1 attribute-2 attribute-3 src="5d5bc37ffcf54c9b82e996823bffbb81"></stream> ​​ Supported attributes autoplay boolean * Tells the browser to immediately start downloading the video and play it as soon as it can. Note that mobile browsers generally do not support this attribute, the user must tap the screen to begin video playback.
